Description: Science Applications International Inc.; its subcontractor, Applied Enterprise Solutions LLC; AES CEO Dale Galloway; and former government employees Stephen Adamec and Robert Knesel agreed to pay the United States a total of $22,676,000 to resolve allegations of false claims in a whistleblower suit. SAIC agreed to pay $20,400,000; AES and Dale Galloway will pay $2,166,000; Adamec and Knesel are paying $110,000.

Science Applications International Corporation (SAIC), now known as Leidos Holdings Inc., agreed to pay $1.5 million to resolve a False Claims Act lawsuit alleging that it knowingly engaged in prohibited conflicts of interest as a contractor for the U.S. Nuclear Regulatory Commission between 1992 and 2000.

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: The company entered into a deferred prosecution agreement and agreed to forfeit more than $500 million to resolve fraud charges involving its failure to investigation allegations that the manager of its New York City government payroll modernization system project was receiving kickbacks from a subcontractor.
Agency: U.S. Attorney-Southern District of New York
Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs

Description: failure to pay out-of-state business registration fee
